page.title: 01Benmore Forest and Loch Eck
page.content: Steep sided hills rising up on both sides of Loch Eck. The summits are over 600m in height. The lower slopes of the hills are planted with coniferous forest. The hill tops which are very rocky are used for grazing sheep. There is a small county hotel called "The Coylet Hotel" and also a small caravan park. The freshwater loch is popular with fisherman. Above the loch on the west side is the "Paper Cave". Tradition has it that the family papers of the Duke of Argyll were hidden in the cave during a period of clan warefare - hence the name. Most of the area is owned by the Forestry Commission.
